Comment:
Hi Everyone!

Ok, not quite the lady at Flambards but nevertheless, Cristiana certainly ended up as Lady Bountiful at the end of this game.  She was playing her mentor, Skorpio47 (aka Klaus) in a Walking the Walk and Learning to Run Welcome MT and she managed a Master Draw against him.  So, I want to learn from Cristiana's experience and just see how she did it.  This MT was a themed tournament called The Dutch Defense.  So, how did she do it?  Well read on......
3. ..... Nf6 - both sides get their king knights out.  A kingside fianchetto is on the cards for these players.

5. ..... 0-0 Cristiana tucks away her king on the kingside.  Kingside castling on both sides seems to be thematic to the Dutch.
5. ..... 0-0 Cristiana tucks away her king on the kingside.  Kingside castling on both sides seems to be thematic to the Dutch.

6. h4!  - allo, allo, allo?  Do we have a Freddy style white pawn advance on the kingside?
7. Be3 - normally this move would be a bit suspect, blocking in the e pawn.  At least there are no pieces on f1 to be blocked in though!
7. Be3 - normally this move would be a bit suspect, blocking in the e pawn.  At least there are no pieces on f1 to be blocked in though!
7. ...... Ng4 - and Cristiana's knight puts the question to that dsb.
9. Qxe3 - and now there is a trade off.  Klaus has a choice, kingside or queenside castling - he defers it until move 14.
9. Qxe3 - and now there is a trade off.  Klaus has a choice, kingside or queenside castling - he defers it until move 14.

11. Rxh5 - meanwhile Klaus' heavies start to gather on the h file.  Can Cristiana muster a good enough defense before all three pile down on it or will Old Matey descend on h7?   We shall see.

11. ..... Qe8 - Cristiana's queen takes a leaf out of Glenda's book - she starts to cosy up to her partner and drive the invader out of her pos!
12. Rh1 - back he goes!
13. ...... dxe5 - a counter in the centre and a pawn trade.
13. ...... dxe5 - a counter in the centre and a pawn trade.
13. ...... dxe5 - a counter in the centre and a pawn trade.
14. 0-0-0 - queenside it is!
15. Kb1 - in a lot of games where the WK or BK goes queenside, a move to the b column is a common procedure.
15. Kb1 - in a lot of games where the WK or BK goes queenside, a move to the b column is a common procedure.
16. ..... Nc7 - away from the rim!

17. ...... e4 - after a doubling on the d column, Cristiana effects a pawn stab.  Klaus puts the knight on a fairly active square, d4 where it will be chased again!

19. ..... b6 - solid, but Cristiana must keep an eye on the h1-a8 diagonal because Klaus' bishop and Cristiana's rook are both on it!

21. ..... Bxf5 - Cristiana responds to the pawn trade by developing her bishop.  She must still keep an eye on her QR though!
